title: Manchester United close in on Mario Mandzukic transfer as Juventus star slashes wage demands
text:
Manchester United are close to agreeing the transfer of Mario Mandzukic ahead of the January transfer window (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United are close to agreeing the transfer of Mario Mandzukic ahead of the January window after the Juventus striker agreed to slash his wage demands.

The 33-year-old was on Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s radar during the summer but his salary demands, according to The Sun, were responsible for the deal collapsing.

The United manager placed his faith in the like of Anthony Martial and Marcus Rashford after allowing Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez to depart for Inter Milan.

Solskjaer’s side has subsequently struggled for goals with Rashford struggling to shoulder the responsibility of leading the line, particularly given the injury which forced Martial to miss eight matches in all competitions.

The Norwegian has built his transfer strategy around signing young, hungry, British players but is prepared to compromise in order to add an experience to his forward line in January.

Paulo Dybala scored twice as Juventus came from behind to beat Lokomotiv Moscow (Picture: Getty)

Mandzukic, who The Sun reports currently earns £300,000-a-week at Juventus, is prepared to take a 50% pay cut in order to move to Old Trafford having been exiled by Maurizio Sarri in Turin.

In the Croatia international’s absence, Juventus kick-started their Champions League campaign last night with a late comeback win over Lokomotiv Moscow thanks to two late goals from Paulo Dybala who himself almost joined United in the summer.

‘I really needed these two goals. It was a good result for me and for the team, as we suffered, but have the necessary experience to keep calm and find a way through,’ Dybala told Sky Sport Italia.

‘We sent the usual signal, which is that this is not a Juventus side without experience or talent. We can have our say.’
